image.altText: A boat tows another boat, with a lot of wake in the water.

items.synopsis: One person is dead following a serious boating mishap off the coast north of Perth, after a member of the public spotted an upturned vessel offshore.

title.children: One person dead, two rescued in serious boating incident off Perth coast

image.altText: Mitchell Walsh serial drink driver WA

items.synopsis: Mitchell Walsh who was involved in the death of schoolgirl Jess Meehan two decades ago is being extradited to Perth after he allegedly skipped bail on fresh drink driving-related charges.

title.children: Serial drink driver who killed 10yo girl extradited from Sydney to face fresh driving charges

image.altText: Adam Simpson looks into the distance wearing a blue polo shirt in front of a dark background

items.synopsis: Adam Simpson says while West Coast's 101-point loss to cross-town rivals Fremantle last weekend warrants questions about his future, it should not be considered in isolation.

title.children: 'Getting the full clarity is important': Eagles coach calls for 'certainty' over future at West Coast

image.altText: A close-up shot of large plastic-wrapped packages containing cocaine and taped up with Australian Federal Police tape.

items.synopsis: Three Queensland men are charged with importing 560 kilograms of cocaine into Western Australia, with the group allegedly collecting the drugs off the coast after they were dropped off by a bulk carrier.

title.children: Police seize half a tonne of cocaine from house after trio allegedly smuggled drugs in via boat

image.altText: planes on an airport runway

items.synopsis: WA Police allege the man became verbally aggressive after being declined alcohol, before he got out of his seat and assaulted a female crew member.

title.children: Perth man charged over alleged assault of Qantas crew member

image.altText: A man with short fair hair, wearing a sleeveless shirt, stands with his back turned and his right arm raised up to a wall.

items.synopsis: A workplace injury sparked a chain of events that left Jonathan sleeping on the floor of his friend's garage, living hours away from his children. It comes as homelessness services are inundated with new people seeking help.

title.children: How does a financially stable family end up homeless? For Jonathon, he never saw it coming

image.altText: A doctor using a stethoscope on a patient.

items.synopsis: It is hoped the service at Manjimup Senior High School in the state's south west will give teens a safe, confidential space to open up about topics like teen pregnancy and mental health issues.

title.children: WA public high school to hire in-house GP for students in state-first trial

image.altText: A man smiling with the ocean and red sand behind him.

items.synopsis: Roger Cook says the government's position strikes the right balance between development, environmental protection, and landowner rights, but Kimberley campaign groups say the fight for a complete ban will continue.

title.children: WA premier doubles down on Kimberley fracking position as environmental groups call for change

image.altText: A man sits in a chair with a purple tie while talking to another man.

items.synopsis: The veteran UK broadcaster was often asked to reflect on his fulfilling career.

title.children: Veteran UK broadcaster Michael Parkinson enjoyed every minute of work he had

image.altText: Several boats are moored at a marina, with palm trees in the background and a shed on the shore

items.synopsis: When two boats set off towards an Indonesian island for a birthday surfing trip, none of those on board could have predicted the next few days. Here's how the survivors managed more than 36 hours at sea.

title.children: How a split-second decision off the island of Aceh may have saved four Australians

image.altText: A woman holding soccer balls and smiling in yellow shirt and black puffy jacket.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has told the Australian public to "watch this space" when it comes to more funding for women's sport in the wake of the Matildas' World Cup successes, after the opposition pledged $250 million.

title.children: 'We don't need a public holiday, we need more funding': Politicians urged to match Matildas' fervour with funding

image.altText: Alisha Fagan appears serious as she stands outside a court building in Melbourne.

items.synopsis: Alisha Fagan, who caused the death of 69-year-old grandfather Sedat Hassan in a 2022 crash, will be eligible for parole in less than six months.

title.children: Melbourne driver who killed grandfather then blamed crash on 'African men' jailed

image.altText: Two bees poke their heads into a golden hive, while another rubs it's front legs together on the outside of the hive.

items.synopsis: American foulbrood — a disease deadly to bees — is detected during routine honey testing by a commercial beekeeper in the Northern Territory.

title.children: Bee disease with potential to wipe out whole colonies found in Top End honey

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a polo shirt with the Maui emergency service agency logo speaks at a press conference

items.synopsis: The resignation comes a day after he said he had no regret about not using sirens to warn residents of wildfires that devastated the historic seaside community of Lahaina and killed at least 111 people.

title.children: Maui's emergency services chief resigns after criticism for not activating alarms

image.altText: Sun setting through a line of transmission towers

items.synopsis: Across Australia, governments have set ambitious goals for turning their power systems green. But a decision to keep a coal plant running longer suggests the rhetoric is not matched by the reality.

title.children: 'Reality catching up with rhetoric' as coal-fired closure delayed

image.altText: Three workers pictured from below wearing high-vis and standing in the doorway of a new Metronet train

items.synopsis: For 100 years, trains were built in the old railway workshops in Midland. After a 30-year hiatus, the industry is back with a modern twist.

title.children: Railcar manufacturing was the heart of this Perth community for 100 years. After three decades, it's back

image.altText: Rear shot of a woman in a purple coat holding a grey mug

items.synopsis: More than 170,000 people across Australia are on the housing waitlist, including people like Annabelle, who faces living out of a car with her cat in a few weeks.

title.children: Annabelle is uni-educated and has an impressive corporate background. She's also homeless at the age of 54

image.altText: A woman looks into the camera and smiles slightly.

items.synopsis: It's legal for one law firm to represent both sides of a real estate transaction but legal experts warn it can make navigating conflict difficult.

title.children: When Christine sold her home, the buyer used the same law firm. Things soon became 'very sticky'

image.altText: red and yellow hazard tape in front of driveway

items.synopsis: Emergency services seized over 50 vials of hazardous materials, which Fire and Rescue NSW (FRNSW) said on Thursday was believed to be low-level radioactive isotopes, from an Arncliffe property on Thursday.

title.children: 'Radioactive isotopes' found in Sydney home did not threaten national security, Australian Border Force says

image.altText: Man in jeans and blue shirt holds a teenage boy on the ground, his face blurred.

items.synopsis: The arrest of the 18-year-old Indigenous man was videoed and shared on social media, which the NSW police minister said was "difficult to watch".

title.children: Police officer on restricted duties as arrest of 18-year-old man in Taree under investigation

image.altText: Woman shown MS-2step

items.synopsis: An estimated one in 10 GPs currently provide abortion services. Experts warn that unless the federal government steps in to extend telehealth services, more women will miss out on crucial health care.

title.children: Government urged to make telehealth services for abortions permanent

image.altText: A soccer player wearing yellow and green sits on her haunches after a game

items.synopsis: Mystery surrounded Alanna Kennedy's late withdrawal from Australia's clash with England, but the Matildas have since confirmed the defender has delayed concussion symptoms.

title.children: Matildas defender Alanna Kennedy to miss Sweden match as reason for semifinal absence is confirmed

image.altText: A pictographic showing 147 icons of stadiums

items.synopsis: More than 11 million Australians watched the Matildas take on England in the FIFA World Cup semifinal in a new national record — here's how that number stacks up.

title.children: How many stadiums could stay-at-home Matildas fans have packed into?

image.altText: John Devitt

items.synopsis: Australian swimming is mourning the death of Olympic gold medallist John Devitt, who broke 14 world records across his 13-year swimming career.

title.children: Aussie swimmer who broke 14 world records and won two Olympic gold medals dies aged 86

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a suit stands behind a lectern labelled "Working for Australia".

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese faces off against an internal rebellion on AUKUS, as some delegates attempt to have references to nuclear-powered submarines struck from the party's platform.

title.children: Albanese defends against attempt to strike nuclear submarines out of Labor platform

image.altText: A man stands with his hands on his head looking at the ASX numbers.

items.synopsis: The Australian share market has recorded its worst week since September 2022 amid lingering concerns about China's sputtering economy and rising bond yields in the US. Look back on Friday's finance and market news with our blog.

title.children: Australian share market suffers worst week in nearly a year over economic uncertainty in China — as it happened

image.altText: Naotunne Vijitha Nayaka Thero sits on a couch wearing a crimson robe.

items.synopsis: The Venerable Naotunne Vijitha Nayaka Thero, who is the abbot of the Dhamma Sarana temple in Melbourne's south-east, is facing 13 charges including sexual penetration of a child under 16 and indecent act with a child under 16.

title.children: Buddhist monk at Melbourne temple faces court on child sex abuse charges

image.altText: A selfie of a young man wearing a hat

items.synopsis: Police say a man and a woman were inside RQ's Tavern at Robina for about 90 seconds before a 26-year-old man was allegedly stabbed in the chest.

title.children: Man, 26, allegedly killed within 90 seconds of couple entering Gold Coast pub, police say

image.altText: Daniel Troy Ames has been jailed for apparent execution style murder of his uncle

items.synopsis: Convicted killer Daniel Troy Ames, who was jailed for the 2009 execution-style murder of his uncle, loses a legal bid to secure a retrial, with an Adelaide court dismissing claims of a deathbed confession by a drug dealer as neither "reliable" nor "compelling".

title.children: Uncle killer loses appeal after court rejects claims of drug dealer 'deathbed confession'

image.altText: Profile photos of two young men.

items.synopsis: Two men, including the brother of NRL star Payne Haas, have been refused bail for a second time after facing a NSW court accused of trafficking a commercial quantity of methylamphetamine.

title.children: Zeda Haas and Kaharua Beer refused bail over alleged role in $3.5m meth importation

image.altText: A Holden ute lifted into the air by a crane

items.synopsis: The Holden ute, worth an estimated $20,000, was reduced to scrap metal by police today, about six months after it was clocked at "one of the highest ever speeds" detected on South Australian roads.

title.children: Holden ute previously clocked at 253kph on Adelaide motorway crushed by police

image.altText: a handful of free-range eggs

items.synopsis: The suspected mushroom-poisoning deaths in Victoria of three people following a lunch has put a focus on the potential consequences of eating the wrong thing. Here's what food safety experts want you to know about food poisoning.

title.children: Here's what a microbiologist says you should know about food poisoning

image.altText: A man and a woman hug, and laugh

items.synopsis: Even when things didn't go to plan, Sir Michael Parkinson's subjects seemed to make great television — here are some of the most memorable moments from the legendary interviewer's chats.

title.children: Five of Parky's most memorable interviews: From John and Yoko to Meg Ryan and Dame Edna
